body:
Might be a font rendering issue maybe?

Try running Alacritty from a different terminal like the cmd.exe, does it produce any output? Errors should be written to stderr if anything went wrong.

I'd assume you're using the default config, right?

Same output whether starting from cmd.exe or from file explorer.  No errors visible.  Yes, default config.

Edit: You weren't suggesting that I'd get a different result from cmd.exe; you were suggesting that I might see some errors.  I don't.
Which GPU do you have? Might been an issue with OpenGL shader support.
ATI Radeon HD 3600

In theory that should just support the minimum required OpenGL version for Alacritty.

Would you mind testing out the example in the glutin repository? You can find it here: https://github.com/tomaka/glutin.

If you've got Rust setup, you can just run that using `cargo run --example window` after cloning the repository. That also uses OpenGL to draw a Window, but if that doesn't work it's not something caused by Alacritty directly.
that glutin example works fine (I see a pink background and a many-hued triangle)
Could you share the output of `alacritty -v`? Maybe that'll give some more insights.

```
C:\downloads\alacritty>Created log file at "C:\\Users\\Standard\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Alacritty-1564.log"
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Configuration loaded from "C:\\Users\\Standard\\AppData\\Roaming\\alacritty\\alacritty.yml"
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Device pixel ratio: 1
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Width: 1024, Height: 768
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Initializing glyph cache...
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] ... finished initializing glyph cache in 1.536031s
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Width: 644, Height: 412
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Cell Size: (8 x 17)
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Padding: (2 x 2)
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] PTY Dimensions: Line(24) x Column(80)
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Using Winpty agent
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Initialisation complete
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Font size changed to Size(22) with DPR of 1
[2019-01-19 15:23] [INFO] Width: 644, Height: 412
```

(the log file contains the same things)

I threw some more `v`s at it - it doesn't look much more interesting to me, but here goes anyway:

```
C:\downloads\alacritty>Created log file at "C:\\Users\\Standard\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Alacritty-10236.log"
[2019-01-19 15:26] [INFO] Welcome to Alacritty

[2019-01-19 15:26] [INFO] Width: 644, Height: 412
```

It looks like a font is actually found and the glyph cache is filled properly. Testing the ConPTY backend by enabling the `enable_experimental_conpty_backend` might be another thing that could be tested, but I'm pretty sure this has to be related to rendering and OpenGL.

I set `enable_experimental_conpty_backend: true` in the config - and it made no difference at all that I can see.  

(I also set `enable_experimental_conpty_backend: foo` and got a warning about that, so I'm pretty sure I'm changing the right file).

The output of `alacritty -v` should change from printing `[INFO] Using Winpty agent` to `[INFO] Using Conpty agent`. Unless your Windows 10 install is not up to date, in which case you should probably update first.
ack, I do see that change - but the alacritty window remains black.

Just noting that I don't see this problem on my Windows PC at work (the problem persists at home, though).  

Well, it was always near-certain that this must be something environmental; but I guess it's reassuring to have that confirmed.

Yeah, as mentioned before my suspicion is an issue with the GPU and potentially OpenGL/GLSL support. The best way to confirm that would probably be to swap out the GPU, but obviously that's easier said than done.

Same issue here, only my cursor won't even move when I type   
`.\alacritty.exe -vvv` only responds on resizing the window.  
Task Manager says Alacritty is running on __GPU 0__, i.e. UHD 630 integrated graphics in my case (instead of the dedicate GTX1050m), dunno if this helps...
@smdsbz Can you force it to run on the dedicated GPU?

> @smdsbz Can you force it to run on the dedicated GPU?

Unfortunately, no luck, it just stays blank like it's dead (but it __does__ respond to config changes like `render_time` on the fly, which gets displayed properly and fluctuates on mouse over).

One thing worth noticing is that it initially starts with GPU 1, then after few seconds, it falls back to GPU 0. I've tried both starting it with the _Run with graphics processor_ option in the right-click menu, and changing the default config in the nVidia panel, behaves the same.

Looks like it fails to communicate with the shell to me.
Could you test a different shell? Like powershell, cmd and maybe bash?

Activity on this thread prompted me to have another go with the latest version - 0.3.0 RC 3 - and with that I get this interesting-looking error message:

```
C:\downloads\alacritty>Created log file at "C:\\Users\\Standard\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\Alacritty-9508.log"
[2019-04-05 19:29] [ERROR] Alacritty encountered an unrecoverable error:

        There was an error initializing the shaders: Failed compiling shader at C:\Users\travis\build\jwilm\alacritty/res/text.v.glsl: Vertex shader failed to compile with the following errors:
ERROR: 0:48: error(#162) Wrong operand types no operation ':' exists that takes a left-hand operand of type 'const float' and a right operand of type 'const int' (or there is no acceptable conversion)
ERROR: 0:49: error(#162) Wrong operand types no operation ':' exists that takes a left-hand operand of type 'const float' and a right operand of type 'const int' (or there is no acceptable conversion)
ERROR: error(#273) 2 compilation errors.  No code generated
```

Does that help?

(I suspect that @smdsbz and I are seeing different issues.)
Hmm, the code in my latest failure looks new since I opened this, so I imagine we now have three problems cluttering this single issue.  Sorry about that.
